body:
I do not quite understand. Is the recommended solution to delete `GOROOT/pkg/linux_arm` whenever I want to re-compile for a different GOARM? Or is there a way so that those (it seems) GOARM dependent binary files are not kept?

If I am not allowed to write to `GOROOT/pkg` I get this error: `go install runtime: mkdir /usr/local/go/pkg/linux_arm/: permission denied` that is why I used to install go to `$HOME/go`.
